nl_problem:
# Task: boggle_solver
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: findWords(self, arg1, arg2)

Given an m x n board of characters and a list of strings words, return all words on the board.
Each word must be constructed from letters of sequentially adjacent cells, where adjacent cells are horizontally or vertically neighboring. The same letter cell may not be used more than once in a word.

Constraints:
- m == board.length
- n == board[i].length
- 1 <= m, n <= 12
- 1 <= words.length <= 3 * 10^4
- 1 <= words[i].length <= 10
- board and words consist of lowercase English letters.
- All strings in words are unique.
lisp_spec:
(task
  (name "boggle_solver")
  (signature ( (board list) (words list) ) list)
  (constraints
    (constraint "m == board.length")
    (constraint "n == board[i].length")
    (constraint "1 <= m, n <= 12")
    (constraint "1 <= words.length <= 3 * 10^4")
    (constraint "1 <= words[i].length <= 10")
    (constraint "board and words consist of lowercase English letters.")
    (constraint "All strings in words are unique.")
  )
  (goal
    (description "Return all words on the board that can be formed by sequentially adjacent cells, where adjacent cells are horizontally or vertically neighboring. The same letter cell may not be used more than once in a word.")
    (rule "Each word must be constructed from letters of sequentially adjacent cells.")
    (return "A list of all valid words found on the board.")
  )
)
